name: Mullaly Skatepark
description: One of the best skateparks in NYC. Deep bowls with excellent flow, a quality street section, and top-tier concrete work. The Bronx's crown jewel of skating.
history: Built 2009–2010, designed by California Skateparks (now Spohn Ranch). The park was a massive win for Bronx skaters who lobbied hard for quality skate infrastructure. Widely praised in the skate community for its design, depth, and flow — often compared favorably to West Coast parks.
bestTimes: Weekday afternoons for shorter waits on the bowl. Weekend mornings before the crowds build. Evening sessions in summer are magical with Yankee Stadium lights in the background.
transitDirections: B/D/4 to 161st St-Yankee Stadium, walk north through Mullaly Park. The skatepark is on the east side of the park.

detailedNotes.terrain: The bowl complex is the star — deep end with pool coping, spine transfers, hips, and multiple lines. The street section has quality ledges, rails, a stair set, and flat bars. Concrete is smooth and well-finished throughout.
detailedNotes.culture: Attracts serious skaters from all boroughs. Bowl etiquette is important here — wait your turn, call your line. The Bronx crew is welcoming but expects respect for the space.
detailedNotes.warnings: The deep bowl is not for beginners — it's legit deep transition. Wear pads if you're learning. The park can feel isolated at night. Best visited during daylight.
mediaAppearances: Multiple pro skater visits filmed here
